categories.name: Active Record Bit Fields
categories.description: Use an integer field to store a set of booleans using bitwise logic

categories.name: Active Record Index Assistants
categories.description: Utilities to point you at potentially missing database indices

categories.name: Active Record Nesting
categories.description: Model database records as nested data structures

categories.name: Active Record Sharding
categories.description: Distribute read and write queries to your database across several database servers to help with scaling

categories.name: Active Record Soft Delete
categories.description: Keep deleted records in the database for auditing and restoring

categories.name: Active Record Timestamps
categories.description: Use timestamp values to represent boolean data

categories.name: Active Record Versioning
categories.description: Keep track of changes to database records for auditing and restoring

categories.name: Pagination
categories.description: Split large data collections into subsets to display on multiple pages

categories.name: Background Jobs
categories.description: Process slow tasks asynchronously to keep response times low, improve fault-tolerance and aid with horizontal scaling

categories.name: Daemon Management
categories.description: Simplify the management of multiple processes

categories.name: Daemonizing
categories.description: Turn your program into a service running in the background

categories.name: Scheduling
categories.description: Execute tasks on a schedule

categories.name: CSS Tools
categories.description: Tools to make working with Cascading Stylesheets (CSS) easier

categories.name: Web UI frameworks
categories.description: Full-featured Web UI frameworks with built-in grids and ready-to-use components

categories.name: Business Logic Frameworks
categories.description: Tools to help with Domain Driven Design approach and organize app's  Control Flow.

categories.name: Service Objects
categories.description: Libraries to isolate application domain logic into separate classes.

categories.name: View Objects
categories.description: Framework agnostic gems that implement Decorator / View Object pattern.

categories.name: Code Coverage
categories.description: Utilities that report which code is being run. Most commonly this is used as test coverage which reports what parts of your code are not tested, but there are also tools to find dead production code

categories.name: Code Metrics
categories.description: Utilities to improve code quality by reporting common code smells like complexity, unsafe defaults, unused variables or stylistic inconsistencies

categories.name: Code Review Tools
categories.description: Utilities that help make code review more consistent and less error-prone by automating checks

categories.name: E-Mail Delivery
categories.description: Easily send e-mails from your Ruby programs

categories.name: Numerical
categories.description: Projects for doing number manipulation.

categories.name: Strings
categories.description: String tools for manipulation, decoding, encoding, verifying, generation, letter case, etc.

categories.name: Structures
categories.description: Projects for working with data structures such as vectors and data frames.

categories.name: ActiveRecord without Rails
categories.description: Projects that help in using ActiveRecord outside of a Rails project.

categories.name: Active Record Database Adapters
categories.description: ActiveRecord comes with built-in support for SQLite, PostgreSQL and MySQL on the offical C-based Ruby implementation commonly referred to as "MRI". These extensions let you connect to other relational databases or use other Ruby implementations like JRuby.

categories.name: Connection Pooling
categories.description: Connection Pools allow you to share a limited number of active connections to external services like databases between multiple threads per Ruby process

categories.name: SQL Database Adapters
categories.description: Low-level adapters for interfacing with various SQL database servers

categories.name: Object-relational mapping
categories.description: Libraries that map SQL database tables and rows to Ruby classes and objects in order to enable easy interaction with the data persistence layer from your program

categories.name: Command Line Option Parsers
categories.description: Utilities to process arguments to terminal command line programs easily

categories.name: Command Line Progress Bars
categories.description: Display progress of your terminal program nicely

categories.name: Command Line Utilities
categories.description: Tools for using Ruby code on the command line

categories.name: Concurrent Processing
categories.description: Tools that simplify the writing of concurrent Ruby programs

categories.name: Gnome libraries
categories.description: Ruby bindings for the Gnome libraries.

categories.name: Ruby Core Extensions
categories.description: Libraries that enhance Ruby's core classes like Hash or String with additional features

categories.name: Gem Creation
categories.description: Tools that aid in creating, maintaining and publishing Rubygems

categories.name: Rails Version Management
categories.description: Tools for managing the Rails versions of new or existing apps

categories.name: Scripting Frameworks
categories.description: Libraries that simplify the writing of command-line interfaces for your Ruby programs

categories.name: Terminal UI
categories.description: Components to build Terminal UIs

categories.name: Documentation Generators
categories.description: Tools for creating API documentation of your Ruby software and it's exposed interfaces

categories.name: OpenAPI Tools (formerly Swagger)
categories.description: Tools for creating, serving or testing with OpenAPI documentation or Swagger tooling

categories.name: Reports & Spreadsheets
categories.description: Tools for parsing spreadsheets and creating reports in multiple formats.

categories.name: Graphing
categories.description: Tools to generate graphical representation of data (called charts or graphs)

categories.name: Template Engines
categories.description: Generate HTML and other markup based on dynamic content

categories.description: Libraries for interacting with MediaWiki, the open source Wiki platform that is also used on Wikipedia

categories.name: JavaScript Tools
categories.description: Utilities for working with JavaScript in Ruby

categories.name: React Tools
categories.description: Tools for integrating with ReactJS

categories.name: Artificial Neural Networks
categories.description: Libraries and Frameworks to train and apply machine learning models based on (Deep) Neural Networks

categories.name: Aeronautics
categories.description: Aviation data sources, flight tracking and so forth

categories.name: Math
categories.description: Math utilities, tools and extensions

categories.description: Libraries to recognize written text in images

categories.description: Expose HTTP-based services from Ruby. Usually these are used with a rack-based Ruby web framework.

categories.description: Extensions and Add-ons for the Ruby-on-Rails web-application framework

categories.name: File Uploads
categories.description: Handle file uploads in Ruby-based web applications, including streamlined storage on cloud services, the extraction of file metadata and handling of post-processing tasks like resizing and cropping of images

categories.name: Web Authentication
categories.description: Handle the authentication of users in web applications written in frameworks like Rails

categories.name: User Authorization
categories.description: Narrow down the visibility and accessibility of operations for users based on roles and similar access control patterns

categories.name: Rails Captcha
categories.description: Captchas help to establish that a user is human to protect websites from bots and spam by presenting challenges that are hard to solve for computers

categories.name: RSpec Matchers
categories.description: Additional RSpec test matchers that help you write more expressive examples

categories.name: Browser testing
categories.description: Write and run automated tests of your web app in a real-world browser environment

categories.description: Frameworks for writing automated tests for your software

categories.description: JSON parsers convert data serialized in the popular JSON data exchange format to and from Ruby objects

categories.name: HTTP clients
categories.description: Easily interact with HTTP-based services

categories.description: Applications allowing to mock API endpoints
